intro: Boechera thompsonii, commonly known as Thompson's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
